Description.p: As a team lead/ senior developer and architect, Mr. Devadoss has worked on multiple projects using technologies like Java, VCM, Vignette Portal, jQuery. Some of his tasks include:

ul.li: Optimizing the cost associated with the alerting mechanism. The alerting mechanism in the portal refreshes every 5 minutes to bring the up to date alerts to the end users. Per the previous implementation, it was costing $250,000 per annum for the client. The new design implemented by Mr. Devadoss' team cut down the total cost, and provided a significant savings to the client.
Identified and implemented the fix for rebates functionality, which was the major cause for the slowness in the portal.
Designed and implemented dashboard functionality in portal for the customers to view several metrics including their purchase history, returns %, etc.

Designed the remove stale users functionality within the portal, which divides the users into 6 segments, based on their last login date and either send notifications reminding them to login or deleting the users from the system if they have not logged in the portal for more than 9 months.
Designed and developed custom permissioning for the portal in addition to the out of the box Vignette Portal permissions.
Designed and lead the team on creating a new functionality that led the admins to create bulk users on the fly thereby saving a lot of time for the portal admins.
Designed and developed a new flow in the content publishing process wherein the content authors can skip the normal workflow and directly publish a particular content item.
Developed the click to order functionality inside the portal.
Worked on several critical production support tasks.

Description.p: Mr. Devadoss has been a part of the team involved in migrating the client's micro sites from Vignette legacy system to Ingeniux CMS.

ul.li: Involved in the architecture of the project.
Requirements gathering and preparing high-level design document.
Creating schemas/views/components in Ingeniux CMS.
Using bootstrap framework to create responsive layouts.
Creating custom site building that would let the content authors take complete ownership of the template.
Creating custom tabs for making the article creation seamless.

This included creation of custom web content display using structures and templates (CTDs), custom page templates, site templates, workflow process, theme creation and layout creation.
As a Software Engineer, Mr. Devadoss was involved in all phases of the software development lifecycle. Tasks included:

ul.li: Working on code modifications, enhancement, and documentation of the ARIB subtitles module depending upon client requirements.
Planning, performing, and directing a QA test plan through various test case scenarios.
Unit testing, sub system testing and the review of ARIB subtitles module, Also involved in the code review of audio, video and HAL modules.
Involvement in the initial three phases of project life cycle planning, analysis, and design.

Converting the ARIB subtitles module of AU project to HD project, integrating ARIB stack with the Middle ware based on the client requirements, developing UI framework from Linux window manager called Enlightenment.

Analyzed functional requirements and designed a centralized utility for authenticating Ameriprise internal users and authorizing their activities on all secured portions of the Ameriprise Financial website.
Performed root-cause analysis for any data anomalies to support both ad hoc and client analytical reporting needs.
Implemented a web portal using C# .NET and SQL Server following the MVC (Model View Controller) architecture.
